review: I say that because of center channel audio and low volume issues I am having. I have read others dealing with the same thing. I have been able to compensate for much of it with my Yamaha RX-V675 Receiver but then my Samsung BD-FM59 Blu-Ray player needs adjusting. Yes I know the audio delivered to the receiver is different which clarifies my uncertainty to whether it is an issue with the Fire TV or not.Anyway, I like the Fire TV a lot. It took a bit to get used to the mixed content but that is past tense now. The video content is ample enough to always have something for me to watch. I am in binge heaven!  I rarely use Netflix now. The games are ok for just quick gaming but my XBOX 360 is still my heavy gaming box. I can't expect the Fire TV to compete with that. Prime music is great. The family has profiles and the lyrics included on some are cool. The Fire TV box is crisp when clicking the remote. I also have two Fire TV Sticks and crispness is obvious between the two. The iPhone app works well but can have latency issue but that can easily be caused by my network and known iPhone Wi-Fi issues.Would i recommend this to a friend?  I do all the time!  This blows away the Roku 2 I have. Waste of money really but I still have a tube TV I use it with.This was my cable cutting solution and I am now $200 a month richer for it. Local channels are pulled in via antenna.I told my other two kids that if they show me all 90's on their grades by Christmas that they will get one along with a flat screen TV. The 3rd child made Honor Roll so you know she did. So there, possibly two more in my future.
